definition: involving advantage or good, a film showing a photographic image whose tones correspond to those of the original subject
details:
adjective
- involving advantage or good
= example: involving advantage or good
= synonyms: plus
- marked by excessive confidence
= synonyms: cocksure, overconfident
- having a positive charge
= example: having a positive charge
= synonyms: electropositive, positively charged
- impossible to deny or disprove
= synonyms: incontrovertible, irrefutable
- formally laid down or imposed
= example: formally laid down or imposed
= synonyms: prescribed
- characterized by or displaying affirmation or acceptance or certainty etc.
= example: characterized by or displaying affirmation or acceptance or certainty etc.
- greater than zero
= example: greater than zero
- reckoned, situated or tending in the direction which naturally or arbitrarily is taken to indicate increase or progress or onward motion
= example: reckoned, situated or tending in the direction which naturally or arbitrarily is taken to indicate increase or progress or onward motion
- indicating existence or presence of a suspected condition or pathogen
= example: indicating existence or presence of a suspected condition or pathogen
= synonyms: confirming
- of or relating to positivism
= synonyms: positivist
- persuaded of
= synonyms: convinced
noun
- a film showing a photographic image whose tones correspond to those of the original subject
- the primary form of an adjective or adverb
